(46) 1.)23rd October, 1946.Copy No.CABINET.COMMITTEE ON OVERSEAS ECONOMIC POLICY.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.AT their meeting on the 3rd October the Cabinet agreed that a Committeeof Ministers should be appointed to keep in touch with the progress of the inter-national discussions on Trade and Employment.The Prime Minister has decided that the Committee appointed for thispurpose shall be established as a Standing Committee with the continuingfunction of handling, under the Cabinet, general questions of external economic policy.2. The membership and terms of reference of the Committee will be asfollows : Membership: Prime Minister (Chairman).Lord President of the Council.Chancellor of the Exchequer.President of the Board of Trade.Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.Secretary of State for India and for Burma.Secretary of State for the Colonies.Minister of Fuel and Power.Minister of Agriculture.Minister of Food.Minister of State.Other Ministers will be invited to attend particular meetings at which questions affecting their Departments are to be discussed.3. Terms of Reference: (a) To watch, on the Cabinets behalf, the progress of the discussions atthe International Conference on Trade and Employment.(b) To consider general questions of external economic policy:4. The Secretaries to the Committee will be : Mr. C. G. Eastwood \ n .Mr. R. Morrison j Cabmet 0ffice-5. As a result of the appointment of this new Committee, the Prime minister has decided to abolish the existing Committee on External Economic Policy and overseas Trade.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,23rd October, 1946.[32587]
